The plant has a short, compact stem with closely arranged leaves that are typically green to reddish in color. Its habitat is typically moist, rocky substrates at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of ecosystem health.
